</ce:para><ce:section-title>Supplementary data</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0065" view="all">Supplementary data to this article can be found online at <ce:inter-ref xlink:href="doi:10.1016/j.inoche.2011.06.035" xlink:type="simple">doi:10.1016/j.inoche.2011.06.035</ce:inter-ref>.</ce:para><ce:simple-para id="sp0055" view="all">[Dy(HL)(L)<ce:inf loc="post">1.5</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>][PMo<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>VO<ce:inf loc="post">40</ce:inf>]·8H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>). H<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>PMo<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>VO<ce:inf loc="post">40</ce:inf>·32.5H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O  (80<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.04<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and DyCl<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (16<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.04<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) were dissolved in water (4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL), and the solution was heated to saturation at 80<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C in a water bath. Orange crystals of DyHPMo<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>VO<ce:inf loc="post">40</ce:inf>·nH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O were formed after cooling the saturated solution and slow evaporation at room temperature. A solvent mixture (10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) of acetonitrile and water (v:v<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>3:2) was used as a buffer layer and very carefully layered over an aqueous solution (4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) of L ligand (35<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in a long and thin tube. Then, the fresh DyHPMo<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>VO<ce:inf loc="post">40</ce:inf>·nH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (90<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, ~<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>0.04<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in 4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL mixture of acetonitrile and water (v:v<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>=<ce:hsp sp="0.12"></ce:hsp>3:1) was slowly layered over the buffer layer. The tube was sealed and left undisturbed at room temperature. After one month, the orange block crystals of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> were obtained in the buffer layer and collected by filtration (Yield: 55% based on Mo). Anal. Calcd for C<ce:inf loc="post">50</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">62</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">61</ce:inf>PVDyMo<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>: C, 19.93; H, 2.06; N, 2.33; Mo, 35.09; V: 1.69. Found: C, 19.95; H, 2.04; N, 2.34; Mo, 35.15; V: 1.62. Selected IR (KBr pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup>): 3120(w), 3059(w), 1620(m), 1562(m), 1509(m), 1457(w), 1375(m), 1055(s), 948(s), 873(m), 796(s). The first weight loss of 6.53% in the temperature range of 50–170<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C of the TG curve corresponds to eight lattice water molecules and three coordinated water molecules in <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> (calculated value 6.58)</ce:simple-para>
clean_text:
Supplementary data

    Supplementary material 1.        Supplementary material 2.        Supplementary material 3.     

Supplementary data

Supplementary data to this article can be found online at doi:10.1016/j.inoche.2011.06.035.

[Dy(HL)(L)1.5(H2O)3][PMo11VO40]⋅8H2O (1). H4PMo11VO40⋅32.5H2O  (80mg, 0.04mmol) and DyCl3⋅6H2O (16mg, 0.04mmol) were dissolved in water (4mL), and the solution was heated to saturation at 80°C in a water bath. Orange crystals of DyHPMo11VO40⋅nH2O were formed after cooling the saturated solution and slow evaporation at room temperature. A solvent mixture (10mL) of acetonitrile and water (v:v=3:2) was used as a buffer layer and very carefully layered over an aqueous solution (4mL) of L ligand (35mg, 0.1mmol) in a long and thin tube. Then, the fresh DyHPMo11VO40⋅nH2O (90mg, ~0.04mmol) in 4mL mixture of acetonitrile and water (v:v=3:1) was slowly layered over the buffer layer. The tube was sealed and left undisturbed at room temperature. After one month, the orange block crystals of 1 were obtained in the buffer layer and collected by filtration (Yield: 55% based on Mo). Anal. Calcd for C50H62N5O61PVDyMo11: C, 19.93; H, 2.06; N, 2.33; Mo, 35.09; V: 1.69. Found: C, 19.95; H, 2.04; N, 2.34; Mo, 35.15; V: 1.62. Selected IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3120(w), 3059(w), 1620(m), 1562(m), 1509(m), 1457(w), 1375(m), 1055(s), 948(s), 873(m), 796(s). The first weight loss of 6.53% in the temperature range of 50-170°C of the TG curve corresponds to eight lattice water molecules and three coordinated water molecules in 1 (calculated value 6.58)
